trans-unit.source: Represents a control that can be set to a value within a range.
Controls may allow recalibration of their supported properties based upon locale or user preference.
An example of this would be a thermometer control that can be set to display the temperature in Fahrenheit or Celsius.
Gets the cached property values for this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern"></xref>.
Cached property values must have been previously requested using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>.
To get the value of a property at the current point in time, get the property by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.Current%2A>.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.RangeValuePatternInformation>.
The cached property values.
The requested property is not in the cache.
Gets the current property values for this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern"></xref>.
This pattern must be from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> with an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode> reference in order to get current values.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> was obtained using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode>, it contains only cached data, and attempting to get the current value of any property raises an exception.
Use <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.Cached%2A> to get the cached value of a property that was previously specified using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.RangeValuePatternInformation>.
The current property values.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.RangeValuePatternInformation.IsReadOnly*> property.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePatternIdentifiers>.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.RangeValuePatternInformation.LargeChange*> property.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePatternIdentifiers>.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.RangeValuePatternInformation.Maximum*> property.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePatternIdentifiers>.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.RangeValuePatternInformation.Minimum*> property.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePatternIdentifiers>.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern"></xref> control pattern.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePatternIdentifiers>.

The pattern identifier is passed to methods such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPattern%2A> to retrieve the control pattern of interest from the specified <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
To be added.
Sets the value associated with the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element.
The actual value set depends on the control implementation.
The control might round the requested `value` up or down.
A UI Automation client can examine the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.RangeValuePatternInformation.Value%2A> property to determine the actual updated value.
The client can also register for a property-changed event on the property and examine the old and new values returned in the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationPropertyChangedEventArgs>.
The new value of the element.
value is less than the minimum or greater than the maximum value of the element.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.RangeValuePatternInformation.SmallChange*> property.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePatternIdentifiers>.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.RangeValuePatternInformation.Value*> property.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePatternIdentifiers>.
To be added.
